text: <a href="../2-Timothy-4-1/" title="2 Timothy 4:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 I charge *thee* therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-2/" title="2 Timothy 4:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-3/" title="2 Timothy 4:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-4/" title="2 Timothy 4:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And they shall turn away *their* ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-5/" title="2 Timothy 4:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 But watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry.
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-6/" title="2 Timothy 4:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-7/" title="2 Timothy 4:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 I have fought a good fight, I have finished *my* course, I have kept the faith:

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-8/" title="2 Timothy 4:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-9/" title="2 Timothy 4:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-10/" title="2 Timothy 4:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-11/" title="2 Timothy 4:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-12/" title="2 Timothy 4:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-13/" title="2 Timothy 4:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 The cloke that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring *with thee*, and the books, *but* especially the parchments.
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-14/" title="2 Timothy 4:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-15/" title="2 Timothy 4:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 Of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-16/" title="2 Timothy 4:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 At my first answer no man stood with me, but all *men* forsook me: *I pray God* that it may not be laid to their charge.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-17/" title="2 Timothy 4:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, and *that* all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-18/" title="2 Timothy 4:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve *me* unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom *be* glory for ever and ever. Amen.
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-19/" title="2 Timothy 4:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.
<a href="../2-Timothy-4-20/" title="2 Timothy 4:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-21/" title="2 Timothy 4:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 Do thy diligence to come before winter. Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

<a href="../2-Timothy-4-22/" title="2 Timothy 4:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 The Lord Jesus Christ *be* with thy spirit. Grace *be* with you. Amen. (*The second *epistle* unto Timotheus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Ephesians, was written from Rome, when Paul was brought before Nero the second time.*)
